intro: Macaranga ruwenzorica, commonly known as the Ruwenzori macaranga, is a species of flowering plant native to the montane forests of East Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests at higher altitudes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
